radiographic_examinations.findings: Large bilateral pleural effusions of low density slightly increased; adjacent atelectasis in the lower lobes bilaterally more marked; focal calcifications along the left hemidiaphragm unchanged; renal calcifications likely vascular; filling defect in the distal esophagus likely a pill; distended appendix with periappendiceal stranding and inflammation; a couple of small organized fluid collections in the right lower quadrant, largest measuring 1.8 x 2.3 cm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Degree of distention of the proximal small bowel has decreased; filling defect in the distal esophagus likely represents a pill; right-sided fluid-containing inguinal hernia decreased in size and no longer containing gas; organized fluid collections in the right lower quadrant minimally decreased from previous examination.
